definition: to rise/to flourish/to become popular/to start/to encourage/to get up/(often used in the negative) to permit or allow (dialect)/maybe (dialect)
feeling or desire to do sth/interest in sth/excitement
to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)
to attain/to reach/to amount to/to communicate/eminent

sentences.english: Respectfully requests, and praying fathers come to enjoy the family size peace, prosperity.
sentences.chinese: 恭请祖宗降临享用，并祈保合家大小平安，兴旺发达。

sentences.english: The 16th Party Congress fully demonstrates that our Party is flourishing and has no lack of successors.
sentences.chinese: 党的十六大充分表明我们党兴旺发达，后继有人。

sentences.english: The 17th Party Congress fully demonstrates that our Party is flourishing and has no lack of successors.
sentences.chinese: 党的十七大充分表明我们党兴旺发达，后继有人。

sentences.english: The business would not thrive without good mangement.
sentences.chinese: 没有良好的经营管理，事业就不会兴旺发达。

sentences.english: The 12th Party congress fully demonstrates that our Party is flourishing and has no lack of successors.
sentences.chinese: 党的十二大充分表明我们党兴旺发达，后继有人。

sentences.english: What should the government do to make the country do to make the country successful and prosperous?
sentences.chinese: 政府该做什么才能令国家兴旺发达？

sentences.english: Market economy, Chinese culture card once again flourishing.
sentences.chinese: 市场经济条件下，中华牌文化再次兴旺发达。

sentences.english: Sticking to use people appropriately will have influence on flourishing of our party's cause.
sentences.chinese: 坚持正确的用人导向关系到党的事业兴旺发达。

sentences.english: The 16th Party congress fully demonstrates that our Patty is flourishing and has no lack of successors.
sentences.chinese: 党的十六大充分表明我们党兴旺发达，后继有人。

sentences.english: His firm will certainly grow and succeed.
sentences.chinese: 他的公司一定会兴旺发达起来。

sentences.english: It is key for the prosperity of the Party and our country to train and select young cadres.
sentences.chinese: 培养和选拔年轻干部是党和国家兴旺发达的关键。

sentences.english: Intelligence flourishes only in the ages when belief withers.
sentences.chinese: 只有在信仰凋敝的年代，智力才会兴旺发达。

sentences.english: More power to Your Excellency and your country.
sentences.chinese: 愿总统阁下和你的国家更加兴旺发达。

sentences.english: A business cannot thrive without good management。
sentences.chinese: 没有良好的经营管理，事业就不会兴旺发达。

sentences.english: I strongly believe that the United States can and will flourish from this competition.
sentences.chinese: 我坚信，美国可以而且必将通过这场竞争兴旺发达。

sentences.english: The coal industry once flourished remarkably in the country.
sentences.chinese: 这个国家的煤炭工业一度很兴旺发达。

definition: becoming more prosperous with each passing day
thriving and prosperous business or trade
profits pouring in from all sides (idiom)/raking in money/bonanza
lit. the divine steed Feihuang gallops (idiom)/fig. to achieve meteoric success in one's career
efficient government, people at peace (idiom); all is well with the state and the people
to bring honor to one's ancestors
the country prospers, the people at peace (idiom); peace and prosperity
to live in peace and work happily (idiom)
